climatePledgeFriendly.details: The Forest Stewardship Council certified products support responsible forestry, helping keep forests healthy for future generations.

features: 【Compostable Materials】Our eco-friendly tableware is made from natural corn, with smooth edges and no woody taste. It can be composted in commercial facilities. Choose our compostable tableware to contribute to environmental protection.
【Natural and Safe】Our disposable cutlery is BPA-free, plastic-free, and free of any harmful chemicals. With BPI certification, we ensure a safe and comfortable dining experience for everyone.

【Sturdy and Durable】No more worrying about fragile plastic or wooden cutlery easily breaking when in use. These heavy duty utensils are super sturdy and durable, allowing you to effortlessly slice and scoop various cold and hot foods.

【Upgraded Longer Cutlery】Our large-sized utensils are suitable for various people to use. Disposable tableware can also be cleaned and reused. Each individual packaging is well sealed for easy storage and transportation.

【Multi-Use & All Occasion】Our disposable tableware is suitable for various foods. It is very suitable for camping, picnics, lunch, dining, barbecues, and party activities. After the party is over, you no longer need to worry about a mess on the table.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great deal on a great product
reviews.reviewText: Wasn't really sure what I would end up with, but ordered these with a commitment to the environment. I was pleased with the quality and durability. Great size and shape. It all comes in a sturdy compact box, too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Biodegradable and sturdy
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with these plastic utensils. They are strong and well made..not thin or flimsy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best compostable utensils I've used - Should be great for backyard BBQs
reviews.reviewText: This is one of those things I didn't realize I should get until I saw it. We'd been using plastic utensils for our BBQ get-togethers in the back yard, mostly because it just made for an easier cleanup. (Yes, I know...do better...I'm trying.) When I saw these on Amazon, I realized we had a better option.I was pleasantly surprised when I got these and tried them out. It was too late in the year for a backyard BBQ, but I just tried using them for normal meals inside the house.I've used compostable utensils before at work and here and there at some fast-food restaurants, but those were usually on the small and thin side. In terms of size and sturdiness, this was closer to the heavy-duty plastic utensils we'd been using...and there really was no difference in use for these compostable utensils compared to those heavy-duty plastic utensils. I've used the knives to cut through 1+-inch slabs of pork chop and the forks to pick up those cuts of pork and to poke through thick sausage skins...worked just as well as the plastic utensils.At this point, I'm looking forward to using these for our next backyard get-together, probably still a few months away, so I can use them and get an even better idea of how well they work. I don't think there will be any problems, but I'll update here if there are.The main thing you may need to consider is cost. Compared to similar heavy-duty plastic utensils, a set similar to this would probably cost $20 or so for the plastic utensils, while these currently cost around $30. I'll leave it up to you if that's acceptable or not, but I personally would be totally fine getting this set at $30 when it's time to get more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These forks/knives/spoons are pretty standard for compostable dinnerware. Of course, I don't really have a way to judge their actual compost-ability, but they feel like other compostable non-plastic utensils I've used in the past. I feel like it's important to use compostable items whenever possible to help reduce the long term impact of single-use disposable plastic waste. They hold up well under normal use and were perfect for use at my girlfriend's birthday party. No complaints, so I suppose I will give the full five stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy set of utensils
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this FEHHTO 100% Compostable Cutlery Set, to use at home, for my son's school lunches, and travel. I like that these are disposable, and made of cornstarch. These are sturdy and well made. We have used them, washed them in the dishwasher and reused several times without any issues. These will last me and family a long time. I will reorder this set again when needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I will recommend this set. It is durable, washable, sturdy, and beautiful. It is also a regular size. The fact that they are eco-friendly is an added perk. it is worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome compostable cutlery!
reviews.reviewText: Wow! I'm very impressed with these. They look and feel the same as thick plastic cutlery, with a major advantage - they don't shatter if you press too hard. Instead, they eventually bend, but they are plenty strong enough to hold up against your food you are trying to cut through/eat. They are thick and well-made, and I see no manufacturing defects looking through them. The teeth of the knife are plenty sharp to cut through things. It's great that they're also compostable on top of already being excellent disposable cutlery! Overall, I think these are a great product if you want very functional cutlery while doing a small bit of good for the environment as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow, excellent quality
reviews.reviewText: These are very thick and sturdy and suited my needs well, but I've never seen such fantastic proportions of forks to other cutlery before! We didn't run out of forks for our event and usually do.
Delivered promptly and exactly what I need to serve plenty of guest for the holidays

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a super nice product that helps the environment with compostable disposable spoons
reviews.reviewText: In a world where environmental awareness is increasing, every small change in our lifestyle contributes to a greener planet. One of these notable changes is observed in the choice of everyday utensils, especially when it comes to organizing events. Enter the “Compostable Disposable Spoons, 6.7”, 150 Piece Heavy Duty Utensils, Eco-Friendly Cornstarch Cutlery, Sustainable and BPI Certified Party Supplies, Plastic Free, Ivory White” – a mouthful, but game-changer for environmentally conscious gatherings. .Natural elegance in every biteMade from natural corn, these compostable utensils feature smooth edges with no woody taste, providing a dining experience that is both sophisticated and eco-friendly. The ivory white finish adds a touch of elegance to your table, proving that durability and style can go hand in hand.Eco-friendly certifications: BPI certified and plastic-freeThese compostable scoops ensure that they can be composted easily and efficiently in commercial facilities. Say goodbye to plastic and harmful chemicals: disposable cutlery is BPA-free, creating a safe and eco-friendly choice for your celebrations.Sustainability redefinedSay goodbye to the days of flimsy plastic or wooden cutlery that breaks easily. The sturdy utensils are built to withstand the demands of any feast. Whether you're cutting a hearty steak or having a delicate dessert, these sturdy utensils won't disappoint. Its durability meets sustainability, allowing you to enjoy your favorite foods without any worries.Longer cutlery for big partiesEnhancing your dining experience, these larger-sized utensils cater to a variety of preferences and are perfect for gatherings of all sizes. The best part? They are not single use. These disposable spoons can be cleaned and reused, making them versatile for all occasions. Each individual package is well sealed for easy storage and transportation, emphasizing convenience without compromising durability.Multi-use, for all occasionsWhether it's a casual family picnic or a large party, these compostable spoons are ready for any occasion. From birthday parties to weddings, you can confidently choose an eco-friendly option without sacrificing convenience or style. Take advantage of the versatility of these utensils and make a positive impact on the environment, one celebration at a time.In conclusion, “compostable disposable spoons” are not just utensils: they are a statement. A statement that says you can enjoy the convenience of disposable cutlery without harming the environment. So the next time you host a gathering, make sure it’s not just a celebration of moments, but also of lasting choices that resonate over time.

These are great. Nice and sturdy and compostable (made of cornstarch) and the mix is ideal; 150 forks, 100 spoons, 50 knives. They’re much stronger than I expected and while they’re no zero-impact, I feel good knowing they won’t outlive me in landfill. We’ve tried wooden cutlery before but found it too coarse. These aren’t. They feel like a sturdier version of disposable plastic cutlery.Got these for my daughter’s birthday party. Along with compostable plates, it made cleanup a breeze. Just fold everything in the plate and chuck it in the compost bin.

I can't believe these are compostable they are really good. Aside from their sturdiness I have to comment on how smooth these are, especially the spoon I find so many of the plastic spoons have a rough or sharp edge these are nice and smooth and soft on the mouth.I put these to the test with some meat from the BBQ and the fork and knife did reasonably well, it's no steak knife but it cut reasonably well.For our second meal test with these I upped the temperature a bit and went with deep fried chicken balls. The temps were a bit much for the fork and when I immediately stuck a fork in a chicken ball that just came out of the fryer. A minute later I stuck a different fork in another ball it the fork was fine. This was a bit extreme and that minute I waited basically represents the time it would take to get the balls dished up and over to the table for someone to put on their plate.All in all I am impressed as others have mentioned these aren't cheap but their quality for the most part gets top marks.
The cutlery set comes with spoons, knives and forks. They are recyclable and are great for my son’s lunch. They feel well made and don’t bend or break when using them
